sentences.en: ...a sensational book in which she damns the ultraright party.
sentences.cn: …她谴责极右党派的一本耸人听闻的书。

sentences.en: ‘Glory be damned!’.
sentences.cn: “什么光荣，见鬼去吧！”。

sentences.en: "Damn!" he yelled at the top of his voice.
sentences.cn: “该死！”他声嘶力竭地喊道。

sentences.en: "It's all here," she said. "Every damn thing."
sentences.cn: “都在这儿了，”她说，“所有的破玩意儿。”

sentences.en: "Wait a damn minute," Mindy spat. "Nobody said anything about staying overnight."
sentences.cn: “该死的，等一下”，明迪愤愤地说道，“谁也没说过要过夜。”

sentences.en: Damn! I’ve left my keys in the office.
sentences.cn: 见鬼！我把钥匙忘在办公室了。

sentences.en: Don't be flippant, damn it! This is serious!
sentences.cn: 该死，不要不当回事！这是很严肃的！

sentences.en: Don't be flippant, damn it! This is serious.
sentences.cn: 别不当回事，该死！这可不是闹着玩儿的事。

sentences.en: Don't lie to me. You know damn well what was happening.
sentences.cn: 别瞒我了, 你压根就很清楚发生了什么事.

sentences.en: I am damn well going to file charges against him.
sentences.cn: 我肯定要对他提出控告

sentences.en: I couldn't get any purchase with the screwdriver on the damn screws.
sentences.cn: 我用螺丝刀拧那些该死的螺丝钉时一点也使不上劲儿。

sentences.en: I couldn't make head nor tail of the damn film.
sentences.cn: 这部该死的影片我一点儿都看不懂。

sentences.en: I damn near went crazy.
sentences.cn: 我当时都快要疯了。

sentences.en: I feel a damn sight better than I did yesterday.
sentences.cn: 我感觉比昨天好多了.

sentences.en: I knew damn well what he was going to say.
sentences.cn: 我非常清楚他要说什么.

sentences.en: I'm damned if I know.
sentences.cn: 我要是知道我就不是人。

sentences.en: It's as near as damn it the same thing.
sentences.cn: 这几乎没什么分别。

sentences.en: Oh damn! I forgot he was coming.
sentences.cn: 真该死！我把他要来这事儿给忘了。

sentences.en: There's not a damn thing you can do about it now.
sentences.cn: 现在你对此做什么都完全无济于事。

sentences.en: Turn off the damn TV!
sentences.cn: 把该死的电视机关掉！

sentences.en: What a damn fool thing to do!
sentences.cn: 做的什么蠢事啊!

trans.tran_cn: （表示厌烦）该死的，可恶的，（加强语气）十足的
trans.tran_en: used when you are angry or annoyed with someone or something

trans.tran_cn: 非常，（表示厌烦）该死，讨厌，十足
该死，见鬼〔表示很生气或失望〕
trans.tran_en: used when you are very annoyed or disappointed
